trans-unit.source: Contains properties that specify how an application should behave relative to new WPF features that are in the WindowsBase assembly.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether information about the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Priority%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is saved to the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref>.
The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets.
If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `false`.
If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `true`.
If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application.
After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if information about the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Priority*> is saved to the <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method puts the delegates on the dispatcher queue or if the delegate is directly invoked.
The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets.
If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `false`.
If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `true`.
If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application.
After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method puts the delegates on the dispatcher queue or if the delegate is directly invoked; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a single <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> is used for multiple dispatcher operations.
The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets.
If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `true`.
If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `false`.
If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application.
After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

true if a single <xref href="System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext"></xref> is used for multiple dispatcher operations; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
